header_1: H5N1 in Wild birds in Azerbaijan
content_1: A new lab in the Khanlar region of Azerbaijan that can detect bird flu and other viruses opened in September. Twenty-six wild and 727 domestic bird samples have been tested so far and all were negative for bird flu according to the State Veterinary Service. Locations tested incuded Absheron Peninsula, Pirallahi Island, regions of Devechi, Salyan, Aghjabadi and Lenkeran.
content_2: At least five ducks have died in a flock of 300 in the delta province of Tra Vinh and tests have identified H5N1. Bird flu had not been reported in Vietnam for almost two months, but the latest outbreak is in the same district that was affected in August. Although the birds on the affected farm had been culled and a transportation ban imposed on the village, some reports suggest that the birds may have died about a month before the virus was reported, raising concerns about possible spread before the culling began.
